intro: Astragalus tribuloides, commonly known as the narrowleaf milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to the western United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has a deep root system that helps it survive in arid conditions. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and are adapted for dispersal by wind or animals. Astragalus tribuloides plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing forage for wildlife in its native range.
